org.apache.myfaces.trinidad.change
Interface ScopedChangePersistence

public interface ScopedChangePersistence

Defines the restricted scope in which ChangeManager should preserve the attribute change involving values of this type. This scope restriction applies only when changes are added via. calls to addComponentChange()method of the ChangeManager and not when changes are added via. calls to its addDocumentChange() or addDocumentChangeWithOutcome() methods. This mechanism can be used by complex types to define the scope in which component changes involving values of those types can be saved. For example, consider implementations of org.apache.myfaces.trinidad.model.RowKeySet being used as value types for current-row attribute in table and treeTable components. While the row currency may not change for table between two requests for the same page, it could change in case of treeTable as it really depends on the node that is expanded. In this case, the treeTable component may choose to restrict saving attribute changes for row currency by implementing this interface in the RowKeySet type it uses.

See Also:
AttributeComponentChange, ChangeManager.addComponentChange(FacesContext,UIComponent,ComponentChange)
